TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit FileStream extends System.IO.Stream

summary.span: 為檔案提供 ，同時支援同步與非同步讀取和寫入作業。

span.span: Provides a for a file, supporting both synchronous and asynchronous read and write operations.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用類別來讀取、 寫入來開啟和關閉檔案，在檔案系統上，以及操作包括管道、 標準的輸入和標準輸出其他檔案相關的作業系統控制代碼。Use the class to read from, write to, open, and close files on a file system, and to manipulate other file-related operating system handles, including pipes, standard input, and standard output. 您可以使用， ， ，和方法來執行同步作業，或， ， ，和執行非同步方法作業。You can use the , , , and methods to perform synchronous operations, or the , , , and methods to perform asynchronous operations. 使用非同步的方法來執行需要大量資源的檔案作業，而不會封鎖主執行緒。Use the asynchronous methods to perform resource-intensive file operations without blocking the main thread. 這項效能考量對於 [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] 應用程式或 [!INCLUDE[desktop_appname](~/includes/desktop-appname-md.md)] 應用程式而言特別重要，尤其是針對耗時的資料流作業可能會阻礙 UI 執行緒，使應用程式看起來像是停止運作的情況。This performance consideration is particularly important in a [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] app or [!INCLUDE[desktop_appname](~/includes/desktop-appname-md.md)] app where a time-consuming stream operation can block the UI thread and make your app appear as if it is not working. 輸入緩衝區和輸出更好的效能。 buffers input and output for better performance. > [!IMPORTANT] > 此類型會實作介面。This type implements the interface. 當您完成使用型別時，您應該處置它直接或間接。When you have finished using the type, you should dispose of it either directly or indirectly. 若要直接處置型別，呼叫其方法中的`try` / `catch`區塊。To dispose of the type directly, call its method in a `try`/`catch` block. 若要處置它間接，使用的語言建構這類`using`（在 C# 中) 或`Using`（在 Visual Basic)。To dispose of it indirectly, use a language construct such as `using` (in C#) or `Using` (in Visual Basic). 如需詳細資訊，請參閱 「 使用物件，實作 IDisposable 」 一節介面 > 主題。For more information, see the "Using an Object that Implements IDisposable" section in the interface topic. 屬性可讓您偵測是否以非同步方式開啟檔案控制代碼。The property detects whether the file handle was opened asynchronously. 當您建立的執行個體時，指定這個值類別的建構函式`isAsync`， `useAsync`，或`options`參數。You specify this value when you create an instance of the class using a constructor that has an `isAsync`, `useAsync`, or `options` parameter. 若屬性是`true`，資料流使用重疊的 I/O，以非同步方式執行檔案作業。When the property is `true`, the stream utilizes overlapped I/O to perform file operations asynchronously. 不過，屬性不一定要`true`來呼叫， ，或方法。However, the property does not have to be `true` to call the , , or method. 當屬性是`false`和您呼叫的非同步讀取和寫入作業，仍不封鎖 UI 執行緒，但實際的 I/O 作業以同步方式執行。When the property is `false` and you call the asynchronous read and write operations, the UI thread is still not blocked, but the actual I/O operation is performed synchronously. 方法支援隨機存取檔案。The method supports random access to files. 允許的讀取/寫入位置移到檔案中的任何位置。 allows the read/write position to be moved to any position within the file. 這是與位元組位移的參考點參數。This is done with byte offset reference point parameters. 是相對於搜尋參考點，可以是開頭、 目前的位置或基礎檔案中，結尾的三個成員所表示的位元組位移列舉型別。The byte offset is relative to the seek reference point, which can be the beginning, the current position, or the end of the underlying file, as represented by the three members of the enumeration. > [!NOTE] > 磁碟檔案一律會支援隨機存取。Disk files always support random access. 在建構時屬性值設定為`true`或`false`取決於基礎檔案類型。如果基礎檔案類型是 FILE_TYPE_DISK，定義 winbase.h，於屬性值是`true`。At the time of construction, the property value is set to `true` or `false` depending on the underlying file type.If the underlying file type is FILE_TYPE_DISK, as defined in winbase.h, the property value is `true`. 否則，請屬性值是`false`。Otherwise, the property value is `false`. 如果處理程序會終止並鎖定檔案的一部分，或關閉具有未完成的鎖定的檔案，則行為會是未定義。If a process terminates with part of a file locked or closes a file that has outstanding locks, the behavior is undefined. 目錄作業和其他檔案作業，請參閱， ，和類別。For directory operations and other file operations, see the , , and classes. 類別是具有主要是針對建立的靜態方法的公用程式類別物件為基礎的檔案路徑。The class is a utility class that has static methods primarily for the creation of objects based on file paths. 類別從位元組陣列建立的資料流，類似於類別。The class creates a stream from a byte array and is similar to the class. 如需常見的檔案和目錄作業的清單，請參閱 < [ 一般 I/O 工作](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common file and directory operations, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md). ## 偵測 Stream 位置變更Detection of Stream Position Changes 當物件沒有其控制代碼的獨佔的按住不放，另一個執行緒可以同時存取的檔案控制代碼及變更作業系統檔案控制代碼相關聯的檔案指標的位置。When a object does not have an exclusive hold on its handle, another thread could access the file handle concurrently and change the position of the operating system's file pointer that is associated with the file handle. 在此情況下，快取的位置中物件和快取的緩衝區中的資料可能會外洩。In this case, the cached position in the object and the cached data in the buffer could be compromised. 物件會定期執行檢查存取快取的緩衝區，以確保作業系統的控制代碼的位置與快取所使用的位置相同的方法上物件。The object routinely performs checks on methods that access the cached buffer to ensure that the operating system's handle position is the same as the cached position used by the object. 如果偵測到的呼叫中的控制代碼的位置中有未預期的變更方法中，.NET Framework 會捨棄緩衝區的內容，並再次從檔案讀取資料流。If an unexpected change in the handle position is detected in a call to the method, the .NET Framework discards the contents of the buffer and reads the stream from the file again. 這可能會影響效能，取決於大小的檔案和任何其他處理程序可能會影響檔案資料流的位置。This can affect performance, depending on the size of the file and any other processes that could affect the position of the file stream. 如果偵測到的呼叫中的控制代碼的位置中有未預期的變更方法，將緩衝區的內容都會被捨棄和擲回例外狀況。If an unexpected change in the handle position is detected in a call to the method, the contents of the buffer are discarded and an exception is thrown. A物件並不會獨佔的按住不放上其控制代碼時任一公開控制代碼存取屬性或物件會得到其建構函式中的屬性。A object will not have an exclusive hold on its handle when either the property is accessed to expose the handle or the object is given the property in its constructor. ## Examples 下列範例示範一些建構函式。The following example demonstrates some of the constructors. [!code-cpp[fstream class#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/FStream Class/CPP/fstream class.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[fstream class#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/FStream Class/CS/fstream class.cs#1)] [!code-vb[fstream class#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/FStream Class/VB/fstream class.vb#1)] 下列範例示範如何以非同步方式寫入檔案。The following example shows how to write to a file asynchronously. 在具有 TextBlock，名為 u 和 連接到名為 Button_Click Click 事件處理常式按鈕的 WPF 應用程式中，執行此程式碼。This code runs in a WPF app that has a TextBlock named UserInput and a button hooked up to a Click event handler that is named Button_Click. 檔案路徑必須存在於電腦上的檔案變更。The file path needs to be changed to a file that exists on the computer. [!code-csharp[Asynchronous_File_IO_async#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Asynchronous_File_IO_async/cs/example3.cs#3)] [!code-vb[Asynchronous_File_IO_async#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/Asynchronous_File_IO_async/vb/example3.vb#3)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 當是呼叫，控制代碼，也會關閉和檔案的控制代碼計數會遞減。When is called, the handle is also closed and the file's handle count is decremented. `FileStream` 假設它有控制代碼的專有控制權。`FileStream` assumes that it has exclusive control over the handle. 讀取、 寫入，或同時搜尋`FileStream`也持有控制代碼可能會導致資料損毀。Reading, writing, or seeking while a `FileStream` is also holding a handle could result in data corruption. 針對資料安全，呼叫之前使用控制代碼，並避免呼叫任何方法以外`Close`完成之後使用控制代碼。For data safety, call before using the handle, and avoid calling any methods other than `Close` after you are done using the handle. > [!CAUTION] > 當您編譯以特定的文化特性設定的一組字元，並擷取這些相同的字元，以不同的文化特性設定時，字元可能無法解譯，而且可能會導致擲回例外狀況。When you compile a set of characters with a particular cultural setting and retrieve those same characters with a different cultural setting, the characters might not be interpretable, and could cause an exception to be thrown. `FileShare.Read` 這些是預設值建構函式，而不需要`FileShare`參數。`FileShare.Read` is the default for those constructors without a `FileShare` parameter. 如需常見的檔案和目錄作業的清單，請參閱 < [ 一般 I/O 工作](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common file and directory operations, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks .NET Framework 不支援直接存取實體磁碟，透過路徑是裝置名稱，例如，「\\\\。 \PHYSICALDRIVE0"。The .NET Framework does not support direct access to physical disks through paths that are device names, such as "\\\\.\PHYSICALDRIVE0 ". `path`參數可以是檔案名稱，包括通用命名慣例 (UNC) 共用上的檔案。The `path` parameter can be a file name, including a file on a Universal Naming Convention (UNC) share. 建構函式有讀取/寫入權限到檔案，並開啟共用讀取權限 (亦即，若要開啟檔案以供寫入這個或另一個處理序將失敗，直到要求`FileStream`物件已關閉，但嘗試讀取則會成功)。The constructor is given read/write access to the file, and it is opened sharing Read access (that is, requests to open the file for writing by this or another process will fail until the `FileStream` object has been closed, but read attempts will succeed). 您無法使用這個建構函式來開啟唯讀檔案;相反地，您必須使用建構函式接受`FileAccess`參數值設為`FileAccess.Read`。You cannot use this constructor to open read-only files; instead, you must use a constructor that accepts a `FileAccess` parameter with the value set to `FileAccess.Read`. 緩衝區大小設定為 4096 個位元組 (4 KB) 的預設大小。The buffer size is set to the default size of 4096 bytes (4 KB). > [!NOTE] > `path` 不需要是儲存在磁碟; 上的檔案它可以是支援透過資料流存取系統的任何部分。`path` is not required to be a file stored on disk; it can be any part of a system that supports access through streams. 例如，根據系統中，這個類別可以存取實體裝置。For example, depending on the system, this class can access a physical device. 已`true`所有封裝檔案的物件。 is `true` for all objects that encapsulate files. 如果`path`表示不支援搜尋，裝置屬性產生是`false`。If `path` indicates a device that does not support seeking, the property on the resulting is `false`. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱 。For additional information, see . `FileShare.Read` 這些是預設值建構函式，而不需要`FileShare`參數。`FileShare.Read` is the default for those constructors without a `FileShare` parameter. 建構函式，而不需要參數，如果`mode`參數設為，是預設存取權。For constructors without a parameter, if the `mode` parameter is set to , is the default access. 否則，將存取設為。Otherwise, the access is set to . > [!CAUTION] > 當您編譯以特定的文化特性設定的一組字元，並擷取這些相同的字元，以不同的文化特性設定時，字元可能無法解譯，而且可能會導致擲回例外狀況。When you compile a set of characters with a particular cultural setting and retrieve those same characters with a different cultural setting, the characters might not be interpretable, and could cause an exception to be thrown. 如需常見的檔案和目錄作業的清單，請參閱 < [ 一般 I/O 工作](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common file and directory operations, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md). ## Examples 下列程式碼範例示範如何將資料寫入至檔案時，位元組，並確認資料已正確地寫入。The following code example shows how to write data to a file, byte by byte, and then verify that the data was written correctly. remarks.format: ## Remarks `FileStream` 假設它有控制代碼的專有控制權。`FileStream` assumes that it has exclusive control over the handle. 讀取、 寫入，或同時搜尋`FileStream`也持有控制代碼可能會導致資料損毀。Reading, writing, or seeking while a `FileStream` is also holding a handle could result in data corruption. 針對資料安全，呼叫之前使用控制代碼，並避免呼叫任何方法以外`Close`完成之後使用控制代碼。For data safety, call before using the handle, and avoid calling any methods other than `Close` after you are done using the handle. 或者，讀取和寫入至控制代碼之前呼叫此`FileStream`建構函式。Alternately, read and write to the handle before calling this `FileStream` constructor. `FileShare.Read` 這些是預設值建構函式，而不需要`FileShare`參數。`FileShare.Read` is the default for those constructors without a `FileShare` parameter. > [!CAUTION] > 當您編譯以特定的文化特性設定的一組字元，並擷取這些相同的字元，以不同的文化特性設定時，字元可能無法解譯，而且可能會導致擲回例外狀況。When you compile a set of characters with a particular cultural setting and retrieve those same characters with a different cultural setting, the characters might not be interpretable, and could cause an exception to be thrown. 如需常見的檔案和目錄作業的清單，請參閱 < [ 一般 I/O 工作](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common file and directory operations, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks `FileStream`物件給指定的存取權的檔案。The `FileStream` object is given the specified access to the file. 將會擁有權的控制代碼所指定。The ownership of the handle will be as specified. 如果此程序擁有的控制代碼，呼叫方法也會關閉控制代碼，而檔案的控制代碼計數會遞減。If this process owns the handle, a call to the method will also close the handle and the file's handle count is decremented. `FileStream`物件會得到預設緩衝區大小為 4096 位元組。The `FileStream` object is given the default buffer size of 4096 bytes. `FileStream` 假設它有控制代碼的專有控制權。`FileStream` assumes that it has exclusive control over the handle. 讀取、 寫入，或同時搜尋`FileStream`也持有控制代碼可能會導致資料損毀。Reading, writing, or seeking while a `FileStream` is also holding a handle could result in data corruption. 針對資料安全，呼叫之前使用控制代碼，並避免呼叫的方法以外`Close`完成之後使用控制代碼。For data safety, call before using the handle, and avoid calling methods other than `Close` after you are done using the handle. `FileShare.Read` 這些是預設值建構函式，而不需要`FileShare`參數。`FileShare.Read` is the default for those constructors without a `FileShare` parameter. > [!CAUTION] > 當您編譯以特定的文化特性設定的一組字元，並擷取這些相同的字元，以不同的文化特性設定時，字元可能無法解譯，而且可能會導致擲回例外狀況。When you compile a set of characters with a particular cultural setting and retrieve those same characters with a different cultural setting, the characters might not be interpretable, and could cause an exception to be thrown. 如需常見的檔案和目錄作業的清單，請參閱 < [ 一般 I/O 工作](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common file and directory operations, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks .NET Framework 不支援直接存取實體磁碟，透過路徑是裝置名稱，例如，「\\\\。 \PHYSICALDRIVE0"。The .NET Framework does not support direct access to physical disks through paths that are device names, such as "\\\\.\PHYSICALDRIVE0 ". `path`參數可以是檔案名稱，包括通用命名慣例 (UNC) 共用上的檔案。The `path` parameter can be a file name, including a file on a Universal Naming Convention (UNC) share. 建構函式有讀取/寫入權限到檔案，並開啟共用讀取權限 (亦即，若要開啟檔案以供寫入這個或另一個處理序將失敗，直到要求`FileStream`物件已關閉，但嘗試讀取則會成功)。The constructor is given read/write access to the file, and it is opened sharing Read access (that is, requests to open the file for writing by this or another process will fail until the `FileStream` object has been closed, but read attempts will succeed). 緩衝區大小設定為 4096 個位元組 (4 KB) 的預設大小。The buffer size is set to the default size of 4096 bytes (4 KB). > [!NOTE] > `path` 不需要是儲存在磁碟; 上的檔案它可以是支援透過資料流存取系統的任何部分。`path` is not required to be a file stored on disk; it can be any part of a system that supports access through streams. 例如，根據系統中，這個類別可以存取實體裝置。For example, depending on the system, this class can access a physical device. 已`true`所有封裝檔案的物件。 is `true` for all objects that encapsulate files. 如果`path`表示不支援搜尋，裝置屬性產生是`false`。If `path` indicates a device that does not support seeking, the property on the resulting is `false`. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱 。For additional information, see . `FileShare.Read` 這些是預設值建構函式，而不需要`FileShare`參數。`FileShare.Read` is the default for those constructors without a `FileShare` parameter. > [!CAUTION] > 當您編譯以特定的文化特性設定的一組字元，並擷取這些相同的字元，以不同的文化特性設定時，字元可能無法解譯，而且可能會導致擲回例外狀況。When you compile a set of characters with a particular cultural setting and retrieve those same characters with a different cultural setting, the characters might not be interpretable, and could cause an exception to be thrown. 如需常見的檔案和目錄作業的清單，請參閱 < [ 一般 I/O 工作](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common file and directory operations, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 您設定`isAsync`參數來`true`以非同步方式開啟檔案控制代碼。You set the `isAsync` parameter to `true` to open the file handle asynchronously. 當參數是`true`，資料流使用重疊的 I/O，以非同步方式執行檔案作業。When the parameter is `true`, the stream utilizes overlapped I/O to perform file operations asynchronously. 不過，此參數不一定要`true`來呼叫， ，或方法。However, the parameter does not have to be `true` to call the , , or method. 當`isAsync`參數是`false`和您呼叫的非同步讀取和寫入作業，仍不封鎖 UI 執行緒，但實際的 I/O 作業以同步方式執行。When the `isAsync` parameter is `false` and you call the asynchronous read and write operations, the UI thread is still not blocked, but the actual I/O operation is performed synchronously. `FileStream` 假設它有控制代碼的專有控制權。`FileStream` assumes that it has exclusive control over the handle. 讀取、 寫入，或同時搜尋`FileStream`也持有控制代碼可能會導致資料損毀。Reading, writing, or seeking while a `FileStream` is also holding a handle could result in data corruption. 針對資料安全，呼叫之前使用控制代碼，並避免呼叫任何方法以外`Close`完成之後使用控制代碼。For data safety, call before using the handle, and avoid calling any methods other than `Close` after you are done using the handle. 或者，讀取和寫入至控制代碼之前呼叫此`FileStream`建構函式。Alternately, read and write to the handle before calling this `FileStream` constructor. `FileShare.Read` 這些是預設值建構函式，而不需要`FileShare`參數。`FileShare.Read` is the default for those constructors without a `FileShare` parameter. > [!CAUTION] > 當您編譯以特定的文化特性設定的一組字元，並擷取這些相同的字元，以不同的文化特性設定時，字元可能無法解譯，而且可能會導致擲回例外狀況。When you compile a set of characters with a particular cultural setting and retrieve those same characters with a different cultural setting, the characters might not be interpretable, and could cause an exception to be thrown. 如需常見的檔案和目錄作業的清單，請參閱 < [ 一般 I/O 工作](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common file and directory operations, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md).

summary.span: 使用指定的讀取/寫入權限、 執行個體擁有權和緩衝區大小，初始化指定檔案控制代碼之 類別的新執行個體。

remarks.format: ## Remarks `FileStream`物件給指定的存取權的檔案。The `FileStream` object is given the specified access to the file. 將會擁有權的控制代碼所指定。The ownership of the handle will be as specified. 如果這個`FileStream`擁有的控制代碼呼叫方法也會關閉控制代碼。If this `FileStream` owns the handle, a call to the method will also close the handle. 特別是，檔案的控制碼計數會遞減。In particular, the file's handle count is decremented. `FileStream`物件有指定的緩衝區大小。The `FileStream` object is given the specified buffer size. `FileStream` 假設它有控制代碼的專有控制權。`FileStream` assumes that it has exclusive control over the handle. 讀取、 寫入，或同時搜尋`FileStream`也持有控制代碼可能會導致資料損毀。Reading, writing, or seeking while a `FileStream` is also holding a handle could result in data corruption. 針對資料安全，呼叫之前使用控制代碼，並避免呼叫任何方法以外`Close`完成之後使用控制代碼。For data safety, call before using the handle, and avoid calling any methods other than `Close` after you are done using the handle. 或者，讀取和寫入至控制代碼之前呼叫此`FileStream`建構函式。Alternately, read and write to the handle before calling this `FileStream` constructor. `FileShare.Read` 這些是預設值建構函式，而不需要`FileShare`參數。`FileShare.Read` is the default for those constructors without a `FileShare` parameter. > [!CAUTION] > 當您編譯以特定的文化特性設定的一組字元，並擷取這些相同的字元，以不同的文化特性設定時，字元可能無法解譯，而且可能會導致擲回例外狀況。When you compile a set of characters with a particular cultural setting and retrieve those same characters with a different cultural setting, the characters might not be interpretable, and could cause an exception to be thrown. 如需常見的檔案和目錄作業的清單，請參閱 < [ 一般 I/O 工作](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common file and directory operations, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks .NET Framework 不支援直接存取實體磁碟，透過路徑是裝置名稱，例如，「\\\\。 \PHYSICALDRIVE0"。The .NET Framework does not support direct access to physical disks through paths that are device names, such as "\\\\.\PHYSICALDRIVE0 ". `path`參數可以是檔案名稱，包括通用命名慣例 (UNC) 共用上的檔案。The `path` parameter can be a file name, including a file on a Universal Naming Convention (UNC) share. 建構函式有讀取/寫入權限到檔案，並開啟共用讀取權限 (亦即，若要開啟檔案以供寫入這個或另一個處理序將失敗，直到要求`FileStream`物件已關閉，但嘗試讀取則會成功)。The constructor is given read/write access to the file, and it is opened sharing Read access (that is, requests to open the file for writing by this or another process will fail until the `FileStream` object has been closed, but read attempts will succeed). 緩衝區大小設定為 4096 個位元組 (4 KB) 的預設大小。The buffer size is set to the default size of 4096 bytes (4 KB). > [!NOTE] > `path` 不需要是儲存在磁碟; 上的檔案它可以是支援透過資料流存取系統的任何部分。`path` is not required to be a file stored on disk; it can be any part of a system that supports access through streams. 例如，根據系統中，這個類別可以存取實體裝置。For example, depending on the system, this class can access a physical device. 已`true`所有封裝檔案的物件。 is `true` for all objects that encapsulate files. 如果`path`表示不支援搜尋，裝置屬性產生是`false`。If `path` indicates a device that does not support seeking, the property on the resulting is `false`. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱 。For additional information, see . > [!CAUTION] > 當您編譯以特定的文化特性設定的一組字元，並擷取這些相同的字元，以不同的文化特性設定時，字元可能無法解譯，而且可能會導致擲回例外狀況。When you compile a set of characters with a particular cultural setting and retrieve those same characters with a different cultural setting, the characters might not be interpretable, and could cause an exception to be thrown. 如需常見的檔案和目錄作業的清單，請參閱 < [ 一般 I/O 工作](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common file and directory operations, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md). ## Examples 此程式碼範例是針對提供之較大範例的一部分方法。This code example is part of a larger example provided for the method. [!code-cpp[System.IO.FileStream3#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.FileStream3/CPP/fstreamlock.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[System.IO.FileStream3#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.FileStream3/CS/fstreamlock.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.IO.FileStream3#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.FileStream3/VB/fstreamlock.vb#2)]

span.span: Using asynchronous I/O correctly can speed up applications by as much as a factor of 10, but using it without redesigning the application for asynchronous I/O can decrease performance by as much as a factor of 10.

remarks.format: ## Remarks .NET Framework 不支援直接存取實體磁碟，透過路徑是裝置名稱，例如，「\\\\。 \PHYSICALDRIVE0"。The .NET Framework does not support direct access to physical disks through paths that are device names, such as "\\\\.\PHYSICALDRIVE0 ". `path`參數可以是檔案名稱，包括通用命名慣例 (UNC) 共用上的檔案。The `path` parameter can be a file name, including a file on a Universal Naming Convention (UNC) share. > [!NOTE] > `path` 不需要是儲存在磁碟; 上的檔案它可以是支援透過資料流存取系統的任何部分。`path` is not required to be a file stored on disk; it can be any part of a system that supports access through streams. 例如，根據系統中，這個類別可以存取實體裝置。For example, depending on the system, this class can access a physical device. 已`true`所有封裝檔案的物件。 is `true` for all objects that encapsulate files. 如果`path`表示不支援搜尋，裝置屬性產生是`false`。If `path` indicates a device that does not support seeking, the property on the resulting is `false`. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱 。For additional information, see . > [!CAUTION] > 當您編譯以特定的文化特性設定的一組字元，並擷取這些相同的字元，以不同的文化特性設定時，字元可能無法解譯，而且可能會導致擲回例外狀況。When you compile a set of characters with a particular cultural setting and retrieve those same characters with a different cultural setting, the characters might not be interpretable, and could cause an exception to be thrown. 如需常見的檔案和目錄作業的清單，請參閱 < [ 一般 I/O 工作](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common file and directory operations, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md). ## Examples 下列程式碼範例示範如何以非同步方式將資料寫入檔案，然後確認資料已正確地寫入。The following code example shows how to asynchronously write data to a file and then verify that the data was written correctly. A`State`會建立物件來將資訊從主執行緒傳遞`EndReadCallback`和`EndWriteCallback`方法。A `State` object is created to pass information from the main thread to the `EndReadCallback` and `EndWriteCallback` methods. summary.span: 使用指定的路徑、建立模式、存取權與共用權限、緩衝區大小、其他檔案選項、存取控制和稽核安全性，初始化 類別的新執行個體。

span.span: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified path, creation mode, access rights and sharing permission, the buffer size, additional file options, access control and audit security.

remarks.format: ## Remarks .NET Framework 不支援直接存取實體磁碟，透過路徑是裝置名稱，例如，「\\\\。 \PHYSICALDRIVE0"。The .NET Framework does not support direct access to physical disks through paths that are device names, such as "\\\\.\PHYSICALDRIVE0 ". 使用此建構函式來套用存取權限時建立檔案的檔案。Use this constructor to apply access rights at the point of creation of a file. 若要存取或修改現有的檔案上的權限，請考慮使用和方法。To access or modify rights on an existing file, consider using the and methods. `fileOptions`參數用來提供更進階的作業建立時可運用的存取權物件。The `fileOptions` parameter is used to provide access to more advanced operations that can be leveraged when creating a object. `path`參數可以是檔案名稱，包括通用命名慣例 (UNC) 共用上的檔案。The `path` parameter can be a file name, including a file on a Universal Naming Convention (UNC) share. > [!NOTE] > `path` 不需要是儲存在磁碟; 上的檔案它可以是支援透過資料流存取系統的任何部分。`path` is not required to be a file stored on disk; it can be any part of a system that supports access through streams. 例如，根據系統中，這個類別可以存取實體裝置。For example, depending on the system, this class can access a physical device. 已`true`所有封裝檔案的物件。 is `true` for all objects that encapsulate files. 如果`path`表示不支援搜尋，裝置屬性產生是`false`。If `path` indicates a device that does not support seeking, the property on the resulting is `false`. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱 。For additional information, see . > [!CAUTION] > 當您編譯以特定的文化特性設定的一組字元，並擷取這些相同的字元，以不同的文化特性設定時，字元可能無法解譯，而且可能會導致擲回例外狀況。When you compile a set of characters with a particular cultural setting and retrieve those same characters with a different cultural setting, the characters might not be interpretable, and could cause an exception to be thrown. 如需常見的檔案和目錄作業的清單，請參閱 < [ 一般 I/O 工作](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common file and directory operations, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md). ## Examples 下列範例會將資料寫入至檔案，並接著會讀取資料使用物件。The following example writes data to a file and then reads the data using the object. [!code-cpp[IO.FileStream.ctor2#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/IO.FileStream.ctor2/cpp/example.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[IO.FileStream.ctor2#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/IO.FileStream.ctor2/CS/example.cs#1)] [!code-vb[IO.FileStream.ctor2#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/IO.FileStream.ctor2/VB/example.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果類別衍生自不支援讀取，呼叫， ，以及方法會擲回。If a class derived from does not support reading, calls to the , , and methods throw a . 如果資料流已關閉，則這個屬性會傳回`false`。If the stream is closed, this property returns `false`. ## Examples 下列範例示範使用`CanRead`屬性。The following example demonstrates a use of the `CanRead` property. 此程式碼的輸出會是 「 MyFile.txt 不是可寫入。 」The output of this code is "MyFile.txt is not writable." 若要取得的輸出訊息"MyFile.txt 可被寫入和讀取。"，變更`FileAccess`參數來`ReadWrite`在`FileStream`建構函式。To get the output message "MyFile.txt can be both written to and read from.", change the `FileAccess` parameter to `ReadWrite` in the `FileStream` constructor. span.span: Clears buffers for this stream and causes any buffered data to be written to the file.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個方法覆寫 。This method overrides . 當您呼叫作業系統 I/O 緩衝區的方法，也會排清。When you call the method, the operating system I/O buffer is also flushed. 除非您明確地呼叫未排清資料流編碼器或處置物件。A stream's encoder is not flushed unless you explicitly call or dispose of the object. 設定至`true`表示資料會從排清緩衝區資料流，但並不會清除編碼器的狀態。Setting to `true` means that data will be flushed from the buffer to the stream, but the encoder state will not be flushed. 這可讓編碼器，讓它可以正確編碼字元的下一個區塊保持其狀態 （部分的字元）。This allows the encoder to keep its state (partial characters) so that it can encode the next block of characters correctly. UTF8，UTF7，其中某些字元可以只編碼編碼器接收或多個相鄰的字元後，會影響此案例。This scenario affects UTF8 and UTF7 where certain characters can only be encoded after the encoder receives the adjacent character or characters. 因為緩衝區可供讀取或寫入，會執行下列兩個函式：Because a buffer can be used for either reading or writing, performs the following two functions: - 任何先前寫入緩衝區的資料複製到檔案，除了其編碼器狀態清除緩衝區。Any data previously written to the buffer is copied to the file and the buffer is cleared except for its encoder state. - 如果是`true`資料先前已從檔案複製到讀取的緩衝區，檔案中目前的位置也會減少在緩衝區中未讀取的位元組數目。If is `true` and data was previously copied from the file to the buffer for reading, the current position within the file is decremented by the number of unread bytes in the buffer. 然後清除緩衝區。The buffer is then cleared. 使用方法多載時您想要確保所有中繼檔案緩衝區中緩衝資料寫入至磁碟。Use the method overload when you want to ensure that all buffered data in intermediate file buffers is written to disk. ## Examples 此程式碼範例是針對提供之較大範例的一部分方法。This code example is part of a larger example provided for the method. [!code-cpp[System.IO.FileStream3#4](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.FileStream3/CPP/fstreamlock.cpp#4)] [!code-csharp[System.IO.FileStream3#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.FileStream3/CS/fstreamlock.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.IO.FileStream3#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.IO.FileStream3/VB/fstreamlock.vb#4)]

ACL 描述個人及/或群組，或沒有，在指定的檔案上的特定動作的權限。An ACL describes individuals and/or groups who have, or do not have, rights to specific actions on the given file. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱[如何：新增或移除存取控制清單項目](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-add-or-remove-access-control-list-entries.md)。For more information, see [How to: Add or Remove Access Control List Entries](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-add-or-remove-access-control-list-entries.md).

summary.span: 取得目前 物件封裝之檔案的作業系統檔案控制代碼。

span.span: The operating system file handle for the file encapsulated by this object, or -1 if the has been closed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個屬性是用於操作-系統提供的系統呼叫作業系統控制代碼 (例如`ReadFile`在 Windows 上)。This property is an operating system handle for use with operating-system-provided system calls (such as `ReadFile` on Windows). 不適用於 C 程式庫函式預期的檔案描述項，例如`fread`。It will not work with C library functions that expect a file descriptor, such as `fread`. 作業系統控制代碼可能已經開啟同步或非同步的方式，依據`FileStream`呼叫建構函式。The operating system handle might have been opened synchronously or asynchronously, depending on which `FileStream` constructor was called. 使用屬性探索是否以非同步方式開啟此控制代碼。Use the property to discover whether this handle was opened asynchronously. 在 Win32 中，這表示重疊 IO 的開啟控制代碼，而且需要不同的參數，來`ReadFile`和`WriteFile`。In Win32, this means the handle was opened for overlapped IO, and it requires different parameters to `ReadFile` and `WriteFile`. > [!CAUTION] > 如果，可能會發生資料損毀`FileStream`會建立，其控制代碼傳遞、 某項作業移動控制代碼的檔案指標，然後`FileStream`會再次使用。Data corruption might occur if a `FileStream` is created, its handle is passed, some operation moves the handle's file pointer, and then the `FileStream` is used again. 多個執行緒無法安全地寫入相同的檔案，同時並`FileStream`緩衝處理程式碼會假設它以獨佔方式控制控制代碼。Multiple threads cannot safely write to the same file simultaneously, and `FileStream` buffering code assumes that it exclusively controls the handle. `FileStream` 可能會擲回如果`FileStream`偵測到某些其他處理序已移動檔案指標。`FileStream` might throw an if `FileStream` detects that some other process has moved the file pointer. 若要避免這個問題，不寫入任何資料到檔案的一部分，`FileStream`可能會有經過緩衝處理，並將檔案指標還原上一次上呼叫方法時發生的位置`FileStream`。To avoid this, do not write any data into a portion of the file that `FileStream` might have buffered, and restore the file pointer to the location it had when methods were last called on `FileStream`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `IsAsync`屬性會偵測是否`FileStream`控制代碼已啟用程式碼以使用以非同步方式開啟屬性正確。The `IsAsync` property detects whether the `FileStream` handle was opened asynchronously, enabling your code to use the property correctly. 在 Win32 中，`IsAsync`正在 true 表示控制代碼已針對重疊 I/O 開啟，並因此需要不同的參數，才能`ReadFile`和`WriteFile`。In Win32, `IsAsync` being true means the handle was opened for overlapped I/O, and thus requires different parameters to `ReadFile` and `WriteFile`. 當您建立的執行個體時，指定這個值類別的建構函式`isAsync`， `useAsync`，或`options`參數。You specify this value when you create an instance of the class using a constructor that has an `isAsync`, `useAsync`, or `options` parameter. 若屬性是`true`，資料流使用重疊的 I/O，以非同步方式執行檔案作業。When the property is `true`, the stream utilizes overlapped I/O to perform file operations asynchronously. 不過，屬性不一定要`true`來呼叫， ，或方法。However, the property does not have to be `true` to call the , , or method. 當屬性是`false`和您呼叫的非同步讀取和寫入作業，仍不封鎖 UI 執行緒，但實際的 I/O 作業以同步方式執行。When the property is `false` and you call the asynchronous read and write operations, the UI thread is still not blocked, but the actual I/O operation is performed synchronously. ## Examples 此程式碼範例是針對提供之較大範例的一部分建構函式。This code example is part of a larger example provided for the constructor. remarks.format: ## Remarks 支援搜尋超過資料流長度的任何位置。Seeking to any location beyond the length of the stream is supported. 當您尋找檔案的長度超過檔案大小將會成長。When you seek beyond the length of the file, the file size grows. 在 Microsoft Windows NT 及更新版本，任何新增至檔案結尾的資料是設定為零。In Microsoft Windows NT and newer, any data added to the end of the file is set to zero. 在 Microsoft Windows 98 或更早版本，任何新增至檔案結尾的資料不會設定為零，表示先前已刪除的資料會顯示資料流。In Microsoft Windows 98 or earlier, any data added to the end of the file is not set to zero, which means that previously deleted data is visible to the stream. 將資料流的位置設定為較大的值，在 Windows 98 或更早版本的資料流結尾以外的位置，可能會導致引發例外狀況。Setting the position of the stream to a large value beyond the end of the stream in Windows 98 or earlier may result in an exception being raised. 如需常見的檔案和目錄作業的清單，請參閱 < [ 一般 I/O 工作](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common file and directory operations, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md). ## Examples 下列範例會使用`Length`和`Position`屬性來檢查檔案結尾條件。The following example uses the `Length` and `Position` properties to check for an end-of-file condition. remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個方法覆寫 。This method overrides . `offset`參數會提供中的位元組位移`array`（緩衝區索引） 中要開始讀取，而`count`參數會提供要從這個資料流讀取的位元組數目上限。The `offset` parameter gives the offset of the byte in `array` (the buffer index) at which to begin reading, and the `count` parameter gives the maximum number of bytes to be read from this stream. 如果已到達資料流結尾，傳回的值會是位元組讀取，則為零的實際數目。The returned value is the actual number of bytes read, or zero if the end of the stream is reached. 讀取的作業成功時，讀取的位元組數目進階資料流的目前位置。If the read operation is successful, the current position of the stream is advanced by the number of bytes read. 如果發生例外狀況，資料流的目前位置不變。If an exception occurs, the current position of the stream is unchanged. 方法會傳回零，只有在到達資料流結尾之後。The method returns zero only after reaching the end of the stream. 否則，一律從資料流讀取至少一個位元組，再傳回。Otherwise, always reads at least one byte from the stream before returning. 沒有資料是否可用，從呼叫時，資料流，此方法將會封鎖直到至少一個位元組的資料可以傳回。If no data is available from the stream upon a call to , the method will block until at least one byte of data can be returned. 實作可以自由地傳回比要求更少個位元組，即使尚未達到資料流結尾。An implementation is free to return fewer bytes than requested even if the end of the stream has not been reached. 使用讀取基本資料型別。Use for reading primitive data types. 不會中斷正在執行讀取的作業的執行緒。Do not interrupt a thread that is performing a read operation. 雖然應用程式可能會出現以解除封鎖的執行緒之後，請執行成功，您的應用程式效能和可靠性，就可能會降低中斷時間。Although the application may appear to run successfully after the thread is unblocked, the interruption can decrease your application's performance and reliability. 如需常見的檔案和目錄作業的清單，請參閱 < [ 一般 I/O 工作](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common file and directory operations, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md). ## Examples 下列範例會讀取來自的內容並將它寫入至另一個。The following example reads the contents from a and writes it into another . span.span: The result value can be less than the number of bytes requested if the number of bytes currently available is less than the requested number, or it can be 0 (zero) if the end of the stream has been reached.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法可讓您執行需要大量資源的檔案作業，而不會封鎖主執行緒。The method enables you to perform resource-intensive file operations without blocking the main thread. 這項效能考量對於 [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] 應用程式或 [!INCLUDE[desktop_appname](~/includes/desktop-appname-md.md)] 應用程式而言特別重要，尤其是針對耗時的資料流作業可能會阻礙 UI 執行緒，使應用程式看起來像是停止運作的情況。This performance consideration is particularly important in a [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] app or [!INCLUDE[desktop_appname](~/includes/desktop-appname-md.md)] app where a time-consuming stream operation can block the UI thread and make your app appear as if it is not working. 非同步方法會用於搭配`async`和`await`Visual Basic 和 C# 中的關鍵字。The async methods are used in conjunction with the `async` and `await` keywords in Visual Basic and C#. 使用屬性來判斷目前的執行個體是否支援讀取。Use the property to determine whether the current instance supports reading. 如果在作業取消之前完成，傳回的工作就會包含值屬性。If the operation is canceled before it completes, the returned task contains the value for the property. 如果已處置之檔案的控制代碼，傳回的工作會包含中的例外狀況屬性。If the handle to the file is disposed, the returned task contains the exception in the property. ## Examples 下列範例示範如何以非同步方式從檔案讀取。The following example shows how to read from a file asynchronously. ACL 描述個人及/或群組，或沒有，在指定的檔案上的特定動作的權限。An ACL describes individuals and/or groups who have, or do not have, rights to specific actions on the given file. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱[如何：新增或移除存取控制清單項目](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-add-or-remove-access-control-list-entries.md)。For more information, see [How to: Add or Remove Access Control List Entries](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-add-or-remove-access-control-list-entries.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個方法覆寫 。This method overrides . 如果指定的值小於目前資料流的長度，則會截斷資料流。If the given value is less than the current length of the stream, the stream is truncated. 在此案例中，目前位置是否大於新的長度，目前位置移到資料流的最後一個位元組。In this scenario, if the current position is greater than the new length, the current position is moved to the last byte of the stream. 如果指定的值大於目前的資料流的長度，展開 資料流時，和目前的位置維持不變。If the given value is larger than the current length of the stream, the stream is expanded, and the current position remains the same. 如果資料流已展開，舊和新的長度之間的資料流的內容為未定義。If the stream is expanded, the contents of the stream between the old and the new length are undefined. 資料流必須支援寫入和搜尋的`SetLength`運作。A stream must support both writing and seeking for `SetLength` to work. > [!NOTE] > 使用屬性來判斷目前的執行個體是否支援寫入，而屬性來判斷是否支援搜尋。Use the property to determine whether the current instance supports writing, and the property to determine whether seeking is supported. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱 和 。For additional information, see and . 如需常見的檔案和目錄作業的清單，請參閱 < [ 一般 I/O 工作](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md)。For a list of common file and directory operations, see [Common I/O Tasks](~/docs/standard/io/common-i-o-tasks.md).

summary.span: 以非同步的方式將一連串的位元組寫入目前的資料流，由這個資料流中目前的位置前移寫入的位元組數目，並且監視取消要求。

span.span: Asynchronously writes a sequence of bytes to the current stream, advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written, and monitors cancellation requests.

returns.span: 表示非同步寫入作業的工作。

span.span: A task that represents the asynchronous write operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法可讓您執行需要大量資源的檔案作業，而不會封鎖主執行緒。The method enables you to perform resource-intensive file operations without blocking the main thread. 這項效能考量對於 [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] 應用程式或 [!INCLUDE[desktop_appname](~/includes/desktop-appname-md.md)] 應用程式而言特別重要，尤其是針對耗時的資料流作業可能會阻礙 UI 執行緒，使應用程式看起來像是停止運作的情況。This performance consideration is particularly important in a [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] app or [!INCLUDE[desktop_appname](~/includes/desktop-appname-md.md)] app where a time-consuming stream operation can block the UI thread and make your app appear as if it is not working. 非同步方法會用於搭配`async`和`await`Visual Basic 和 C# 中的關鍵字。The async methods are used in conjunction with the `async` and `await` keywords in Visual Basic and C#. 使用屬性來判斷目前的執行個體是否支援寫入。Use the property to determine whether the current instance supports writing. 如果在作業取消之前完成，傳回的工作就會包含值屬性。If the operation is canceled before it completes, the returned task contains the value for the property. 如果已處置之檔案的控制代碼，傳回的工作會包含中的例外狀況屬性。If the handle to the file is disposed, the returned task contains the exception in the property. ## Examples 下列範例示範如何以非同步方式寫入檔案。The following example shows how to write asynchronously to a file. span.span: Any stream with an internal buffer should override this method and provide a much more efficient version that reads the buffer directly, avoiding the extra array allocation on every call.
